comments:
I created dialog using earlier version of VE. Now, when I click on .java file
with latest Eclipse (3.1.1) and VE (1.1.0.1) it says "Error trying to set new
file into editor" Reason: NullPointerException.

After opening the file with the VE editor (with the errors), do a Project->clean All
close the file, close the project, ReOpen the project and open the file again.

Also getting NullPointerException with some classes i've been developing. The cause of the exception seems to differ from previous poster's. Cleaning the project as described doesn't help. Versions also Eclipse (3.1.1), VE (1.1.0.1).

I managed to pinpoint at least one cause to the problem in one small dialog class and avoid it by removing the parentShell -parameter (marked with *) from new Shell constructor in my code:

private void createDialogWindow(Shell parentShell) {
...
dialogWindow = new Shell(*parentShell, SWT.APPLICATION_MODAL | SWT.DIALOG_TRIM);
...

The problem still persists in my other classes, which are considerably larger and harder to debug. Haven't been able to find the problem (if it is just a single problem) from those.

Sri, can you try and reCreate this one

I think I found the reason (at least in my case): Removing WST plugin (0.7.1) from Eclipse instalation prevents VE breaking this way (java.lang.NullPointerException). I tried it on 2 different installations of Eclipse with broken VE and it worked for both. Markus, do you have wst/jst installed? If so, try removing *.wst.* and *.jst.* directories from both /plugin and /features.
